channel.title: Whonix Tor Browser tor-over-tor by default?
channel.description:
I am using whonix workstation on virtualbox. Downloaded today, updated today.
1) using tor browser downloader shortcut - 6.5a1 hardened does not download
2) so i downloaded 6.5a1 - seems i got tor over tor here.
a) firefox and tor browser shows different ips on whatsmyipaddress.com
b) to check if that was tor over tor i installed https://fruho.com/ and logged into freebook vpn
c) inside vpn, tor browser still show tor exit node.
Does that means that default whonix tor browser is making tor over tor?

item.title: Whonix Tor Browser tor-over-tor by default?
item.dc:creator: Patrick
item.description:
tetadevaca:
  1. using tor browser downloader shortcut - 6.5a1 hardened does not download

Discussed here:
https://forums.whonix.org/t/cannot-download-hardened-tor-browser-using-tor-browser-updater-whonix

tetadevaca:

c) inside vpn, tor browser still show tor exit node.

Don’t use a VPN without reading and going through the documentation. And if you go through the documentation, you will know why that happens and how to prevent that.

The very short exemplification why that is so is because Whonix uses stream isolation by default which has the disadvantage that combination of tunnels such as VPNs becomes more difficult and requires documentation.

Whonix

Tunnels/Introduction

Instructions on how to combine tunnels (VPN, SSH, proxy) with Tor. (User -> Tor -> proxy/VPN/SSH -> Internet) (User -> proxy/VPN/SSH ->...

Read full topic
item.source: Whonix Tor Browser tor-over-tor by default?

item.title: Whonix Tor Browser tor-over-tor by default?
item.dc:creator: entr0py
item.description:
tetadevaca:

Does that means that default whonix tor browser is making tor over tor?

https://www.whonix.org/wiki/Tor_Browser#tor-launcher

FYI, the “a” in 6.5a1 stands for alpha - meaning it’s more experimental than a beta release. Make sure you’re comfortable with entrusting your anonymity to such software: Multiple Tor Browsers is Awful Decision by TPO

Read full topic
item.source: Whonix Tor Browser tor-over-tor by default?

item.title: Whonix Tor Browser tor-over-tor by default?
item.dc:creator: Ego
item.description:
Good day,

No. The differences in IP can be explained by Stream Isolation: https://www.whonix.org/wiki/Stream_Isolation

Have a nice day,

Ego

Read full topic
